title: Meet expectations
content: Think And Grow Rich is a curation of the 13 most common habits of wealthy and successful people, distilled from studying over 500 individuals over the course of 20 years. If The Intelligent Investor is the bible for investing, then Think And Grow Rich is the bible for successful people in general. This book examines the psychological power of thought and the brain in the process of furthering your career for both monetary and personal satisfaction. Originally published in 1937, this is one of the all-time self-help classics and a must-read for investors and entrepreneurial types. It seamlessly draws out the basic instinct or says the inborn pattern of great leaders, entrepreneurs, blatant determined people who changed the world we live in. For ages, great leaders, entrepreneurs have been transited from mediocrity to exceptionally talented. And I think this is why you should read this.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021

title: Verified Purchase
content: Many of the claims in this book are highly exaggerated claims (aka lies) that are unverified and some being just pure imagination, the book speaks of ‚Äúmanifesting‚Äù and willing money to you by thinking your way into the attraction of money, which is a pure lie, you cannot ‚Äúattract‚Äù money to you, mindset is important to the foundation of success, but without discipline and hard work you are nothing no matter how much you think about money. The author was a conman who was never in his life actually rich when you look into his background and had a history of running scams during his lifetime. Now I will not completely bash this book for I only read 6 chapters and despite me being ready to throw the book in the trash after only  reading half of it, there are still a lot of positive things you can take from the book, as I mentioned earlier, mindset is key for the foundation of success, and this book speaks all about mindset. I would not recommend this book to anyone reading it with the intention of actually learning to become successful, But I will recommend it to those seeking to better their mindset but I will advise that you read the book critically and not to take everything that is said in the book at face value.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024

title: Mind opening read
content: "Think and Grow Rich" by Napoleon Hill is a powerful book that has had a profound impact on my mindset and approach towards achieving success. This timeless classic delves into the principles of success and provides practical guidance on how to cultivate a mindset geared towards achieving one's goals and ambitions. Hill explores the power of positive thinking, persistence, and the importance of setting clear goals. By applying the principles outlined in the book, I have witnessed significant personal growth, increased motivation, and a heightened sense of purpose. "Think and Grow Rich" is a must-read for anyone seeking to unlock their full potential and create a life of abundance and fulfillment. I highly recommend this book to those who are ready to embark on a transformative journey towards success.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought this book because it was praised and recommended by Bob Proctor who I had a chance to listen to in a video. Now seeing Bob Proctor was very special, everyone knows he is famous, but yet he sounded so genuine and real that I was quite taken by him and what he said about the book by Napoleon Hill, it turned his life around many, many years ago when he wasn't rich. Now I thought, I have to read this book. I have to apologize, I am not even half through the book yet, but this book is intense and I love reading intense books. The story Napoleon Hill relates about his son is unbelievable, but yet to be believed, because he bases his concept about his knowledge of the human mind on it and backs it up with this story. The subconscious mind can be trained and influenced from birth in order to achieve incredible things in life, or when it is trained and influenced badly in early life, it will exactly accomplish this in later life, it will end up as criminal, unsuccessful, unrewarding, or simply as a botched up life. Yet, the conscious mind, that we are aware of, can do nothing about that and will have to just follow along with what the subconscious mind has been set up with in early childhood.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2013

title: Verified Purchase
content: Did Napoleon Hill really know all of those rich people? Did he really advise presidents, save lives, and cure deafness? Does the Law of Attraction really work? The book makes me feel good. In Think and Grow Rich, the author repeatedly states that all great riches start with an "idea". That makes me feel good, because I've got tons of ideas. I love sharing ideas and thinking. The book also said that it's impossible to get something for nothing. If you want something out of life, you have to provide something in return. I dodged the question of whether or not the Law of Attraction works. I don't know. I use it, but I'm not sure if it works.

title: Nice!
content: One takeaway I got from this book was that all of these men followed the habit of exchanging ideas through conferences. When they had a problem to solve they got together and talked freely until they came up with a plan that would help them. Today this is commonly called a Master Mind principle and is practiced by many groups and organizations all over the world.
